subsection.title: 2. Graph a linear equation by the intercept method

statement.p: Graph the equation 3x+2y=7 by the intercept method.

solution.p: First, we find the x- and y-intercepts of the graph. To find the y-intercept, we substitute 0 for x and solve for y: \begin{aligned}[t] 3(\alert{0})+2y \amp =7 \amp \amp \blert{\text{Simpify the left side.}}\\ 2y \amp =7 \amp \amp \blert{\text{Divide both sides by 2.}}\\ y \amp =\dfrac{7}{2}=3\dfrac{1}{2} \amp \amp \end{aligned} The y-intercept is the point (0, 3\dfrac{1}{2}). To find the x-intercept, we substitute 0 for y and solve for x: \begin{aligned}[t] 3x+2(\alert{0}) \amp =7 \amp \amp \blert{\text{Simpify the left side.}}\\ 3x \amp =7 \amp \amp \blert{\text{Divide both sides by 3.}}\\ x \amp =\dfrac{7}{3}=2\dfrac{1}{3} \amp \amp \end{aligned} The x-intercept is the point (2\dfrac{1}{3}, 0).

The temperature, T, in Nome was -12 \degree at noon and has been rising at a rate of 2 \degree per hour all day.
Write and graph an equaton for T in terms of h, the number of hours after noon.
Find the intercepts of the graph and interpret their meaning in the context of the problem situation.

sidebyside.p: An equation for T at time h is T=-12 +2h To find the T-intercept, we set h=0 and solve for T. T=-12+2(\alert{0})=-12

solution.p: The T-intercept is (0,-12). This point tells us that when h=0, T=-12, or the temperature at noon was -12 \degree. To find the h-intercept, we set T=0 and solve for h. \begin{aligned}[t] \alert{0} \amp = -12+2h \amp \amp \blert{\text{Add 12 to both sides.}}\\ 12 \amp = 2h \amp \amp \blert{\text{Divide both sides by 2.}}\\ 6 \amp =h \amp \amp \end{aligned} The h-intercept is the point (6,0). This point tells us that when h=6, T=0, or the temperature will reach zero degrees at six hours after noon, or 6 pm.

subsection.title: 4. Solve an equation for one of the variables

statement.p: Solve the equation 2x-3y=8 for y.

p.me: \begin{aligned}[t] 2x-3y \amp = 8 \amp \amp \blert{\text{Subtract 2x from both sides.}}\\ -3y \amp = 8-2x \amp \amp \blert{\text{Divide both sides by} -3.}\\ y \amp =\dfrac{8-2x}{-3} \amp \amp \blert{\text{Divide each term of the numerator by} -3.}\\ y \amp =\dfrac{8}{3}-\dfrac{2}{3}x \amp \amp \end{aligned}

statement.p: Solve the equation A=\dfrac{h}{2}(b+c) for b.

p.me: \begin{aligned}[t] A \amp = \dfrac{h}{2}(b+c) \amp \amp \blert{\text{Multiply both sides by 2.}}\\ 2A \amp = h(b+c) \amp \amp \blert{\text{Divide both sides by}~h.}\\ \dfrac{2A}{h} \amp = b+c \amp \amp \blert{\text{Subtract c from both sides.}}\\ \dfrac{2A}{h}-c \amp = b \amp \amp \end{aligned}
